result.execSummary:
All charges against Diamond Lynn Diverse in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Diamond Lynn Diverse is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diamond Lynn Diverse

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CM262, 21CM521, 21CM612, 21CM617, 22CF133 & 22CF37 (STC):
CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Liddle. DA:  Karl E Anderson   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Diamond Lynn Diverse appeared. Case called at 4:53 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status conference. There is a resolution. DA Anderson recites agreement. No restitution are being requested. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE would like the former name of Brandon J. be removed. Court will look into and seal that name. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM521, NO CONTEST to Ct. 2 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 21CM612 and Ct. 2 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM617. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM521, NO CONTEST to Ct. 2 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 21CM612 and Ct. 2 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM617. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct.2 in 21CM521, Ct's 1, 3 & 4 in 21CM612, Ct's 1 & 3 in 21CM617. 21CM262, 22CF133 & 22CF37 are dismissed in their entirety. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. DE's mother makes statement. 20 days to appeal. Court adjourned at 5:26 p.m. 

Crt orders:
In Ct. 1 in 21CM521:
- S/W 2 years Probation. Report to Probation by Friday 04/29/22 at 3 p.m. Call tomorrow. 
- Court costs of $243.00. Payable to DOC over the course of Probation. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00
- AODA within 30 days and follow through with recommendations
- Psychological Assessment if requested by Agent
- Any other evaluation at Agent requests
- 60 days jail STAYED.
- Absolute Sobriety
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
- No abusive contact with Kristi Jo D.
- Continue with current therapy
- Pay supervision fees

ADDRESS INFO for Diamond Lynn Diverse
Current: 665 Monette Avenue, #1, New Richmond, WI 54017   (Effective: 01-25-2022)
Prior: 665 Monettte Avenue, #1, New Richmond, WI 54017
Status conference on February 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

AMENDED

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kelly Kirkland-Flatt.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joe Swartz or Kristi Jo Denver.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

08:48 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: Berhow, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer, DF:  Diamond Lynn Diverse appeared from jail. Court reviews case, competency issues pending in Branch 2 and 4 cases. Atty. Selmer states that DE has advised that she is willing to proceed with evaluation. ADA Ballo responds. DE is prepared to move forward with competency evaluation in this case. Court finds reason to doubt DE's competency and orders DE to complete examination by DHS within 15 days of admittance to in-patient treatment. Court sets status conference. Atty. Selmer requests bond modification. ADA Ballo objects. Court questions Atty. Selmer regarding bond modification argument. Court modifies cash amount of bond. Court reminds DE that if released from jail, competency evaluation still needs to be completed. Adjourned: 9:09 AM. kma  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
For grant or reduction of bail. Filed by Atty Selmer on 02/09/22. arc   to kp on 02/09/22
Status conference on February 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.

03:00 PM   Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel  ADA:   Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Diamond Lynn Diverse appeared from jail.  Set for PH. Atty Brekken makes statements regarding pending cases in which issue of competency has been raised, notes 21CM521, is unsure on how to proceed today, notes an exam has been scheduled and competency hearing on 21CM521 on 2/22 before Branch II. Atty Selmer agrees with Atty Brekken. Court takes judicial notice of  21CM521, finds good cause to extend time limits. Court will set I/R for Branch 1 for 2/4, and SJN can determine how to schedule on this matter. Atty Selmer will be filing Motion. Adjourned at 3:09 pm.
Filed by Atty Selmer. km

Preliminary hearing on January 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kelly Kirkland-Flatt.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joe Swartz or Kristi Jo Denver.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
